required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Role of Pancreatic Triglyceride Content in Beta-cell Function
clinical_study.official_title: Role of Pancreatic Triglyceride Content in Beta-cell Function

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

clinical_study.source: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: The study evaluates if fat accumulates in the pancreas in individuals at risk of developing obesity-related diabetes. It also evaluates if the amount of fat in the pancreas can predict the residual functional capacity of the pancreas (insulin secretion).

primary_outcome.description: Pancreatic and liver triglyceride (fat) content measured by the magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS) technique in volunteers with a wide range of body mass index (BMI).

primary_outcome.measure: Beta-cell Function; AIRg - Acute Insulin Response to Glucose
primary_outcome.description: Beta-cell function as measured by frequently sampled intravenous glucose tolerance test (FSIVGTT) in volunteers with a wide range of body mass index (BMI). AIRg - acute insulin response to glucose. Blood samples were collected at -5, -1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, 14, 19, 22, 25, 30, 40, 50, 70, 100, 140, and 180 minutes, where time 0 is when an i.v. bolus of 50% glucose solution (0.3 g/kg) was injected.

Sensitivity index measured during frequently sampled intravenous glucose tolerance test (FSIVGTT) in volunteers with a wide range of body mass index (BMI). Blood samples were collected at -5, -1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, 14, 19, 22, 25, 30, 40, 50, 70, 100, 140, and 180 minutes, where time 0 is when an i.v. bolus of 50% glucose solution (0.3 g/kg) was injected. Higher numbers indicates better insulin sensitivity Insulin sensitivity was estimated as Matsuda index using formula = 10,000 / (FPG x FPI x Glucosemean0-180 x Insulinmean0-180)0.5, where FPG = fasting plasma glucose and FPI = fasting plasma insulin.

Disposition index measured during frequently sampled intravenous glucose tolerance test (FSIVGTT) in volunteers with a wide range of body mass index (BMI). Blood samples were collected at -5, -1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, 14, 19, 22, 25, 30, 40, 50, 70, 100, 140, and 180 minutes, where time 0 is when an i.v. bolus of 50% glucose solution (0.3 g/kg) was injected. Disposition index (DI) was used to characterize the correlation between β-cell sensitivity and insulin sensitivity and was determined using formula DI = AIRg x SI (from outcomes 2 and 3). Higher numbers indicates a better improvement in beta-cell function.

arm_group.description: Normal weight and normal glucose tolerance.
Impaired fasting glucose of impaired glucose tolerance.
Overweight or obese volunteers, but with normal fasting and postprandial glucose levels.

intervention.description: This is a cross-sectional observational study, no intervention is planned.

study_pop.textblock: We enroll adult volunteers of all ethnicities who have no contraindications to the study procedures or use medications that interfere with our measurements.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adults without prior history of pancreatic disease (other than diabetes)
Exclusion Criteria:
- use of unapproved medications
- contraindications to the MRI procedure
- contraindications to frequent blood draws
- pregnancy
- use of more than 2 alcoholic drinks/day

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

outcome.description: Sensitivity index measured during frequently sampled intravenous glucose tolerance test (FSIVGTT) in volunteers with a wide range of body mass index (BMI). measure.title: Insulin Sensitivity (SI)
measure.description: Sensitivity index measured during frequently sampled intravenous glucose tolerance test (FSIVGTT) in volunteers with a wide range of body mass index (BMI). Blood samples were collected at -5, -1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, 14, 19, 22, 25, 30, 40, 50, 70, 100, 140, and 180 minutes, where time 0 is when an i.v. bolus of 50% glucose solution (0.3 g/kg) was injected. outcome.title: Disposition Index (DI)
outcome.description: Disposition index measured during frequently sampled intravenous glucose tolerance test (FSIVGTT) in volunteers with a wide range of body mass index (BMI). Blood samples were collected at -5, -1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, 14, 19, 22, 25, 30, 40, 50, 70, 100, 140, and 180 minutes, where time 0 is when an i.v. bolus of 50% glucose solution (0.3 g/kg) was injected. Disposition index (DI) was used to characterize the correlation between β-cell sensitivity and insulin sensitivity and was determined using formula DI = AIRg x SI (from outcomes 2 and 3). Higher numbers indicates a better improvement in beta-cell function.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
